paragraphs: The words “NO PARKING” shall be painted on the surface within each access aisle in letters a minimum of 12 inches (305 mm) in height and located to be visible from the adjacent vehicular way.
subsections.title: Lettering.

paragraphs: EVCS identification signs shall be provided in compliance with Section 11B-812.8.
subsections.title: Identification signs.

paragraphs: Where four or fewer total EVCS are provided, identification with an International Symbol of Accessibility (ISA) and signs identifying van accessible spaces shall not be required.
subsections.title: Four or fewer.

paragraphs: Where five to twenty-five total EVCS are provided, one van accessible EVCS shall be identified by an ISA complying with Section 11B- 703.7.2.1. The required standard accessible EVCS shall not be required to be identified with an ISA.
subsections.title: Five to twenty-five.

paragraphs: Where twenty-six or more total EVCS are provided, all required van accessible and all required standard accessible EVCS shall be identified by an ISA complying with Section 11B-703.7.2.1.
subsections.title: Twenty-six or more.

paragraphs: Ambulatory EVCS shall not be required to be identified by an ISA.
subsections.title: Ambulatory.

paragraphs: Drive-up EVCS shall not be required to be identified by an ISA.
subsections.title: Drive-up.

paragraphs: Identification signs shall be reflectorized with a minimum area of 70 square inches (45 161 mm2).
subsections.title: Finish and size.

paragraphs: Required identification signs shall be visible from the EVCS it serves. Signs shall be permanently posted either immediately adjacent to the vehicle space or within the projected vehicle space width at the head end of the vehicle space. Signs identifying van accessible vehicle spaces shall contain the designation “van accessible.” Signs shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground surface measured to the bottom of the sign. Signs located within a circulation path shall be 80 inches (2032 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground surface measured to the bottom of the sign. Signs may also be permanently posted on a wall at the interior end of the vehicle space.
subsections.title: Location.

figures: figure:https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/CABC2022P4/Chapter 11b Accessibility To Public Buildings Public Accommodations Commercialbuildings And Public Housing - California Building Code, Title 24, Part 2 (Volumes 1 & 2) with July 2024 Supple_files/Fig11B_812.9.jpg
paragraphs: EVCS vehicle spaces shall provide surface marking stating “EV CHARGING ONLY” in letters 12 inches (305 mm) high minimum. The centerline of the text shall be a maximum of 6 inches (152 mm) from the centerline of the vehicle space and its lower corner at, or lower side aligned with, the end of the vehicle space length.
FIGURE 11B-812.9
SURFACE MARKING
subsections.title: Surface marking.

paragraphs: Adult changing facilities shall be provided within a unisex (single-user or family) toilet room or other similar private room.
subsections.title: Location.

paragraphs: Adult changing facilities shall provide features in compliance with Section 11B-813.2.
subsections.title: Features.

paragraphs: Adult changing tables shall be fixed to the floor or a wall and shall comply with Section 11B-813.2.1.
subsections.title: Adult changing table.

paragraphs: Adult changing tables shall have a changing surface of 70 inches (1778 mm) minimum length and 30 inches (762 mm) minimum width.
subsections.title: Size.

figures: figure:https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/CABC2022P4/Chapter 11b Accessibility To Public Buildings Public Accommodations Commercialbuildings And Public Housing - California Building Code, Title 24, Part 2 (Volumes 1 & 2) with July 2024 Supple_files/Fig11B_813.2.1.2.jpg
paragraphs: A 36 inches (914 mm) minimum width side clearance shall be provided along the entire length of one side of adult changing tables. At both ends of adult changing tables, clearance shall be provided measuring 36 inches (914 mm) minimum wide and a minimum length as long as the table width plus the width of the side clearance. End and side clearances shall be measured from the outermost extent of the table. Floor or ground surfaces of clearances shall comply with Section 11B-302. Changes in level are not permitted.
CLEARANCE AROUND ADULT CHANGING TABLE
subsections.title: Clearance.

paragraphs: Adult changing table height shall be adjustable from 17 inches (432 mm) above the floor or ground to 38 inches (965 mm) above the floor or ground, as measured to the top of the changing surface. Height adjustability shall be powered. Operable parts shall comply with Section 11B-309.
subsections.title: Height and operation.

paragraphs: Adult changing tables shall provide a minimum weight capacity of 300 pounds (136 kg).
subsections.title: Capacity.

paragraphs: When deployed, changing tables shall not obstruct the required width of an accessible route except as allowed by Section 11B-307.2.
subsections.title: Obstructions.

paragraphs: A door, in any position, shall be permitted to encroach into the turning space by 12 inches (305 mm) maximum. Where a clear floor space complying with Section 11B-305.3 is provided within the room beyond the arc of the door swing, doors shall be permitted to swing into the clear floor space, clearance required for any fixture and clearance required for adult changing tables.
subsections.title: Door swing.

paragraphs: Each door to adult changing facilities shall have a privacy latch.
subsections.title: Privacy latch.

paragraphs: A room identification sign complying with Section 11B-216 shall be provided at entrances to adult changing facilities. The text of the room identification sign shall be “ADULT CHANGING ROOM”.

An informational sign complying with Section 11B-216 shall be provided within adult changing facilities and in close proximity to the changing table. The informational sign shall indicate the maximum weight capacity of the adult changing table, as determined by the table manufacturer.

Where the commercial place of public amusement has a central directory, the central directory shall indicate the location of adult changing facilities. Where other directories indicate the location of toilet facilities, the other directories shall also indicate the location of adult changing facilities.
subsections.title: Signs.

paragraphs: No fewer than one water closet in compliance with Section 11B-604.
subsections.title: Water closet.

paragraphs: One lavatory in compliance with Section 11B-606.
subsections.title: Lavatory.

paragraphs: No fewer than one waste receptacle in compliance with Section 11B-603.5.
subsections.title: Waste receptacle.

paragraphs: No fewer than one coat hook shall be provided in close proximity to the changing table and within one of the reach ranges specified in Section 11B-308.
subsections.title: Coat hook.

paragraphs: No fewer than one shelf shall be provided in close proximity to the changing table at 40 inches (1016 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1219 mm) maximum above the finish floor.
subsections.title: Shelf.

paragraphs: Where provided, no fewer than one of each accessory shall comply with Section 11B- 603.5.
subsections.title: Accessories.

paragraphs: Turning space complying with Section 11B-304 shall be provided within adult changing facilities.
subsections.title: Turning space.

paragraphs: Required clear floor spaces, clearance at fixtures and turning space shall be permitted to overlap.
subsections.title: Overlap.

paragraphs: The provisions of Division 9 shall apply where required by Division 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this chapter.
subsections.title: Scope.

paragraphs: Dining surfaces and work surfaces shall comply with Sections 11B-902.2 and 11B-902.3.
Exception: Dining surfaces and work surfaces for children’s use shall be permitted to comply with Section 11B-902.4.
subsections.title: General.

paragraphs: A clear floor space complying with Section 11B-305 positioned for a forward approach shall be provided. Knee and toe clearance complying with Section 11B-306 shall be provided.
subsections.title: Clear floor or ground space.

paragraphs: The tops of dining surfaces and work surfaces shall be 28 inches (711 mm) minimum and 34 inches (864 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.
subsections.title: Height.

paragraphs: Accessible dining surfaces and work surfaces for children’s use shall comply with Section 11B-902.4.

Exception: Dining surfaces and work surfaces that are used primarily by children 5 years and younger shall not be required to comply with Section 11B-902.4 where a clear floor or ground space complying with Section 11B-305 positioned for a parallel approach is provided.
subsections.title: Dining surfaces and work surfaces for children’s use.

paragraphs: A clear floor space complying with Section 11B-305 positioned for forward approach shall be provided. Knee and toe clearance complying with Section 11B-306 shall be provided, except that knee clearance 24 inches (610 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground shall be permitted.
subsections.title: Clear floor or ground space.

paragraphs: The tops of tables and counters shall be 26 inches (660 mm) minimum and 30 inches (762 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.
subsections.title: Height.

sections.title: B -902 Dining surfaces and work surfaces

paragraphs: Benches shall comply with Section 11B-903.
subsections.title: General.

paragraphs: Clear floor or ground space complying with Section 11B-305 shall be provided and shall be positioned at the end of the bench seat and parallel to the short axis of the bench.
subsections.title: Clear floor or ground space.

paragraphs: Benches shall have seats that are 48 inches (1219 mm) long minimum and 20 inches (508 mm) deep minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) deep maximum.
subsections.title: Size.

figures: figure:https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/CABC2022P4/Chapter 11b Accessibility To Public Buildings Public Accommodations Commercialbuildings And Public Housing - California Building Code, Title 24, Part 2 (Volumes 1 & 2) with July 2024 Supple_files/Fig11B_903.4.jpg
paragraphs: The bench shall provide for back support or shall be affixed to a wall along its long dimension. Back support shall be 48 inches (1219 mm) long minimum and shall extend from a point 2 inches (51 mm) maximum above the seat surface to a point 18 inches (457 mm) minimum above the seat surface. Back support shall be 21/2 inches (64 mm) maximum from the rear edge of the seat measured horizontally.
FIGURE 11B-903.4
BENCH BACK SUPPORT
subsections.title: Back support.

paragraphs: The top of the bench seat surface shall be 17 inches (432 mm) minimum and 19 inches (483 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.
subsections.title: Height.

paragraphs: Benches shall be affixed to the wall or floor. Allowable stresses shall not be exceeded for materials used when a vertical or horizontal force of 250 pounds (1112 N) is applied at any point on the seat, fastener, mounting device or supporting structure.
subsections.title: Structural strength.

paragraphs: Where installed in wet locations, the surface of the seat shall be slip resistant and shall not accumulate water.
subsections.title: Wet locations.

paragraphs: Check-out aisles and sales and service counters shall comply with the applicable requirements of Section 11B-904.
subsections.title: General.

paragraphs: All portions of counters required to comply with Section 11B-904 shall be located adjacent to a walking surface complying with Section 11B-403.
subsections.title: Approach.

paragraphs: Check-out aisles shall comply with Section 11B-904.3.
subsections.title: Check-out aisles.

paragraphs: Aisles shall comply with Section 11B-403.
subsections.title: Aisle.

figures: figure:https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/CABC2022P4/Chapter 11b Accessibility To Public Buildings Public Accommodations Commercialbuildings And Public Housing - California Building Code, Title 24, Part 2 (Volumes 1 & 2) with July 2024 Supple_files/Fig11B_904.3.2.jpg
paragraphs: The counter surface height shall be 38 inches (965 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. The top of the counter edge protection shall be 2 inches (51 mm) maximum above the top of the counter surface on the aisle side of the check-out counter.
FIGURE 11B-904.3.2
CHECK-OUT AISLE COUNTERS
subsections.title: Counter.

paragraphs: Where provided, check writing surfaces shall comply with Section 11B-902.3.
subsections.title: Check writing surfaces.

paragraphs: When not all check-out aisles are accessible, accessible check-out aisles shall be identified by a sign clearly visible to a person in a wheelchair displaying the International Symbol of Accessibility complying with Section 11B-703.7.2.1. The sign shall be a minimum of 4 inches by 4 inches (102 mm by 102 mm).
subsections.title: Identification sign.

figures: figure:https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/CABC2022P4/Chapter 11b Accessibility To Public Buildings Public Accommodations Commercialbuildings And Public Housing - California Building Code, Title 24, Part 2 (Volumes 1 & 2) with July 2024 Supple_files/Fig11B_904.4.jpg
paragraphs: Sales counters and service counters shall comply with Section 11B-904.4.1 or 11B-904.4.2. The accessible portion of the counter top shall extend the same depth as the sales or service counter top.

Exception: In alterations, when the provision of a counter complying with Section 11B-904.4 would result in a reduction of the number of existing counters at work stations or a reduction of the number of existing mail boxes, the counter shall be permitted to have a portion which is 24 inches (610 mm) long minimum complying with Section 11B-904.4.1 provided that the required clear floor or ground space is centered on the accessible length of the counter.
FIGURE 11B-904.4 (EXCEPTION)
ALTERATION OF SALES AND SERVICE COUNTERS
subsections.title: Sales and service counters.

paragraphs: A portion of the counter surface that is 36 inches (914 mm) long minimum and 34 inches (864 mm) high maximum above the finish floor shall be provided. A clear floor or ground space complying with Section 11B-305 shall be positioned for a parallel approach adjacent to the 36 inch (914 mm) minimum length of counter.
Exception: Where the provided counter surface is less than 36 inches (914 mm) long, the entire counter surface shall be 34 inches (864 mm) high maximum above the finish floor.
subsections.title: Parallel approach.

paragraphs: A portion of the counter surface that is 36 inches (914 mm) long minimum and 34 inches (864 mm) high maximum shall be provided. Knee and toe space complying with Section 11B-306 shall be provided under the counter. A clear floor or ground space complying with Section 11B-305 shall be positioned for a forward approach to the counter.
subsections.title: Forward approach.

paragraphs: Counters in food service lines shall comply with Section 11B-904.5.
subsections.title: Food service lines.

paragraphs: Self-service shelves and dispensing devices for tableware, dishware, condiments, food and beverages shall comply with Section 11B-308.
subsections.title: Self-service shelves and dispensing devices.

paragraphs: The tops of tray slides shall be 28 inches (711 mm) minimum and 34 inches (864 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.
subsections.title: Tray slides.

paragraphs: Where counters or teller windows have security glazing to separate personnel from the public, a method to facilitate voice communication shall be provided. Telephone handset devices, if provided, shall comply with Section 11B-704.3.
subsections.title: Security glazing.
